Apple faces criminal sanctions for defying App Store antitrust order (permalink) Epic, makers of the wildly popular Fortnite video-game, have waged a one-company war against the "app tax" – the 15-30% rake that the mobile duopoly of Apple/Google take out of every penny we spend inside of apps. Epic's own digital practices are hardly spotless: just this year, the company was caught cheating players – many of them children – with deceptive practices and had to refund over $72m: https://www.ftc.gov/enforcement/refunds/fortnite-r
title: Pluralistic: Apple faces criminal sanctions for defying App Store antitrust order (01 May 2025)
